title: Resident Situated Learning Program through Emergency Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Physiology and Emergency Care Procedures
context.additional_context: A medical simulation-based situational learning program designed for elementary science teachers, emphasizing role allocation and decision-making training for real emergency responses

learning_goals: In emergency simulation scenarios, learners can distinguish and execute role-specific participation strategies (observer/assistant/manager) with 80% accuracy
Learners can analyze situational cues (patient condition, resource availability, etc.) to determine appropriate levels of learning engagement
Learners can apply situational learning theory to write reflective journals during team-based emergency response processes and incorporate peer feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
